 Really? Care to point out which facts she misrepresented? It is our contention that it's the pro-death advocates who misrepresent the facts in order to justify their infanticidal proclivities and justifications as they release women of all personal responsibility and expect the innocent child to be sacrificed at the alter of their immoral lifestyle so they can continue to act irresponsibly.
 
 
 She asked how we would feel if we were killed. The fact that we have consciousness, awareness of ourselves(sentience) makes us different from the fetus during the level of development when the vast majority of abortions occur.

 
 Her question shows depth and a true sense of justice since she recognizes that every human being she knows in life was once exactly like the infants you justify killing in the womb. She understands by first hand experience and appreciation for the life of all human beings that what currently exists in the womb of every pregnant woman will most assuredly become one of us if only allowed to complete the gestation process. 
 
 It is painfully obvious to many of us that if we have value as existing human beings, then we possessed that same value in the womb, although it was yet to be realized. The rationalization it takes to negate the value of a human life based on what can only be considered technical semantics is the lamest type of justification for murder. 
 
 I must ask why it is considered illegal for a husband to put a bullet into his wife's or child's brain while they sleep? Or to just unplug a coma victim when no one knows if and when they will awaken. These people have no conscious awareness either at the time of their death, yet like the baby all they possess at that moment is potential. 
 
 Who is it that defined the value of an individual life as beginning at birth when science has affirmed absolutely that the process of growth and development starts at the moment of conception? I'll tell you who Jake; it's the pro-death advocates who have used this empty rationale in order to justify this industry of infanticide and give it an appearance of moral acceptability to the uninformed who are grasping for any reason to relieve the inevitable guilt which so many women experience after snuffing out the light of the flame of their own babies life. 
 
 I mean, why are there thousand of web sites like this one How To Protect Your Unborn Baby During Pregnancy From Serious Infections if the unborn have no value, and a lack of conscious sentience is a valid argument for killing them in the womb? Why are you so blind as to fail to recognize that you can't have it both ways by arguing that the unborn only has value if the woman wants it, but is disposable if she doesn't. Are you totally blind to the hypocrisy and double standard which such a shallow perspective represents? emoticon_rolleyes

Archangel

You mean the semantics like "'Fetus' is from the latin for 'young one' [note that this is technically false] so a fetus must be a child"?

 
 From your link: fetus: 
 1398, from L. fetus "the bearing, bringing forth, or hatching of young," from L. base *fe- "to generate, bear," also "to suck, suckle" (see fecund).
 
 Sounds accurate to me.
 
 
See above for one. I'd add that her facts about post-20-week abortions happening 'all the time' is also false (see table one),

 
 She is absolutely right that abortions are performed on 5 month old babies all the time. Do you think they schedule them only sporadically? The fact is that out of 1.3 million abortions performed each year, although 20 week abortions aren't the majority, even a small percentage adds up to a lot of them. 
 In America more than 165,000 abortions are done yearly to babies who are in the second and third trimester. 90,000 13-15 weeks, 60,000 16-20 weeks, 15,000 21 or more weeks, 600 after 26 weeks (6 months old) .Abortion facts
 
 
 as well as the fact about the reasons for abortion - see here again - "3% of respondents said that the "most important reason" for their decision was concern for their own health, and another 3% cited concern that the fetus had a health problem", or wikipedia.

 
 
 If you knew the process you would know that a doctor can bypass "age of fetus limitations" by simply having the woman sign a paper saying she is concerned for her health. 
 Three-fourths of women cite concern for or responsibility to other individuals; three-fourths say they cannot afford a child; three-fourths say that having a baby would interfere with work, school or the ability to care for dependents; and half say they do not want to be a single parent or are having problems with their husband or partner.[8]
 Also, 
  Fifty percent of U.S. women obtaining abortions are younger than 25: Women aged 20-24 obtain 33% of all abortions, and teenagers obtain 17%.[7]
 
  Women who have never married obtain two-thirds of all abortions.[3]
 Facts on Induced Abortion in the United States
 
 http://www.guttmacher.org/graphics/2008/01/10/chart1.gif
iangb

If you knew the process you would know that a doctor can bypass "age of fetus limitations" by simply having the woman sign a paper saying she is concerned for her health.

JakeCJB

Feel free to point out what she said that was ignorant in any way.

 Eighty-nine percent of abortions occur in the first 12 weeks of pregnancy, 2004.
 Facts on Induced Abortion in the United States

in order to justify their infanticidal proclivities and justifications as they release women of all personal responsibility and expect the innocent child to be sacrificed at the alter of their immoral lifestyle so they can continue to act irresponsibly.

That's not immoral. Not wanting to be like a brood mare, and actually have a choice and control over your reproduction and reproductive organs does not make one immoral. It doesn't make one an infanticidalist.
 
 
Her question shows depth and a true sense of justice since she recognizes that every human being she knows in life was once exactly like the infants you justify killing in the womb. She understands by first hand experience and appreciation for the life of all human beings that what currently exists in the womb of every pregnant woman will most assuredly become one of us if only allowed to complete the gestation process.

 
 That's not true, it's not exactly like us, and this is the point. It has DNA, a genetic blueprint. That's all. You cannot confuse only a potential with what something is in actual reality. 
 
 
It is painfully obvious to many of us that if we have value as existing human beings, then we possessed that same value in the womb, although it was yet to be realized. The rationalization it takes to negate the value of a human life based on what can only be considered technical semantics is the lamest type of justification for murder.

 
 No, you're confusing the potential with the actual. It is very technical, because it's based on physically observed evidence. Your claim comes from the notion of a soul from conception. There's no evidence for your assertion. 
 
 
I must ask why it is considered illegal for a husband to put a bullet into his wife's or child's brain while they sleep? Or to just unplug a coma victim when no one knows if and when they will awaken. These people have no conscious awareness either at the time of their death, yet like the baby all they possess at that moment is potential.

 
 We also all have the potential to die, but we're not actually dead. That's part of the same process of life. What constitutes a human person is a different debate. It may indeed make sense to pull the plug, and not keep the person alive on machines, when there is no hope.
 
 However, if the person may recover, they have already reached the point of being a human person, and will pick up where they left off. I however, could not be forced to volunteer part of my body to keep the person alive, just as a pregnant woman cannot be force to volunteer her uterus for the Pope. 
 
 
Who is it that defined the value of an individual life as beginning at birth when science has affirmed absolutely that the process of growth and development starts at the moment of conception? I'll tell you who Jake; it's the pro-death advocates who have used this empty rationale in order to justify this industry of infanticide and give it an appearance of moral acceptability to the uninformed who are grasping for any reason to relieve the inevitable guilt which so many women experience after snuffing out the light of the flame of their own babies life.

 
 This is a rant. Science does see life as an ever-moving process. Many things can be said to be alive, and have potential, IF they go through this process or IF they go through that process. Your basing the idea that it's a human person on potential and DNA alone. Most conception die in spontaneous abortions(ususally in the first two weeks of pregnancy). These all have the DNA and potential. The problem your side has is with women having the choice to control their reproduction. 
 
 
I mean, why are there thousand of web sites like this one How To Protect Your Unborn Baby During Pregnancy From Serious Infections if the unborn have no value, and a lack of conscious sentience is a valid argument for killing them in the womb? Why are you so blind as to fail to recognize that you can't have it both ways by arguing that the unborn only has value if the woman wants it, but is disposable if she doesn't. Are you totally blind to the hypocrisy and double standard which such a shallow perspective represents? emoticon_rolleyes

 
 Yes, it does have value only if the woman wants it, in the early stages, when it doesn't have sentience, only potential and DNA. Because then it has value only because of a woman's wants and choices and her dreams for the future. Nothing else gives it value.

Whether someone else considers HER pregnancy to be of value is of no importance.
